sentences.english: The Xerox is a good office assistant, which you never get tired of using.
sentences.chinese: 静电复印机，文秘好助手，百用不厌。

sentences.english: It is necessary for the students who learning the major of secretaryship to practise teaching.
sentences.chinese: 实践教学环节对文秘专业学生的培养必不可少。

sentences.english: Training direction of amanuenses major in higher vocational college is applied talents.
sentences.chinese: 高职文秘专业培养应用型人才。

sentences.english: She decided to do a secretarial course.
sentences.chinese: 她决定修一门文秘课程。

sentences.english: Principal and also the nature of the equivalent of clerical personnel.
sentences.chinese: 主事也就相当于文秘性质的人员。

sentences.english: Please make an appointment with my secretary.
sentences.chinese: 请跟我文秘定个见面时间。

sentences.english: Some secretarial experience and a cooperative personality.
sentences.chinese: 略具文秘经验和有与人合作的精神。

sentences.english: The teaching from the secretary started late, but developed very fast.
sentences.chinese: 我国高校的文秘专业教学起步虽晚，但发展很快。

sentences.english: Some secretarial experience and cooperative personality are musts.
sentences.chinese: 必须略具文秘经验和肯与人和作的精神。

sentences.english: In my grandma's time, secretaries of work units would be able to cut mimeograph stencils.
sentences.chinese: 在奶奶那个年代，单位的文秘都要求会刻写蜡版呢。

sentences.english: Writs were obtained from the Chancery Writ Office, a department of state.
sentences.chinese: 令状是从文秘署处获得，那是一个独立的国家机关。

sentences.english: We are in need of a secretary with typing speed at 150 words per minutes.
sentences.chinese: 我们想找一个打字速度每分钟不低于150字的文秘。

definition: civilian post (as opposed to military)/civil service/administration
cashier/to receive and hand over payment/to lend and borrow books
to do odd jobs/to do unskilled work
to accept a job offer/to apply for an advertised position
odd jobs/servant or army orderly doing odd jobs
